===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|おとこ|yomi=k}}
/woto<small>2</small>ko<small>1</small>/: [wotwoko] → [wotoko] → [otoko]. Cognate with the verb [[おつ|wot-]] "to become young" with [[子|ko]] as a male suffix. Contrasts with [[乙女|otome]], the female version.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|おとこ|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おとこ|hhira=をとこ}}

# [[man]]; [[male]] person.

====Antonyms====
* {{ja-r|女|おんな}}: [[woman]], [[female]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|お|yomi=k}}
/wo/: [wo] → [o]. The male equivalent to [[女|me]] "female, woman".

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|お|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|雄}}, {{ja-l|牡}}, {{ja-l|夫}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|お|hhira=を}}

# male
# a man
# a husband
